results.title: Driving Miss Daisy
results.creator_credit: Bruce Beresford, Lili Zanuck, Richard Zanuck, Warner Bros Pictures and Zanuck Company
results.brief_description: The funny, touching and totally irresistible story of a working relationship that became a twenty-five year friendship. When Daisy Werthan (Jessica Tandy) crashes her car, her son Boolie (Dan Ackroyd) insists that his mother’s driving days are over. He hires a chauffeur for her, Hoke Colburn (Morgan Freeman) to keep her out of trouble. But feisty Daisy resents the intrusion and she almost drives Hoke crazy with her insistence that she doesn’t need his help. Luckily, Hoke is a very patient man and the pair become the best of friends after 25 years of driving together. Winner of 4 Academy Awards including Best Picture and Best Actress. Screenplay by Alfred Uhry based on his play.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bruce Beresford, Lili Zanuck, Richard Zanuck, Warner Bros Pictures and Zanuck Company

results.title: An introduction to color mixing using the Liquitex Color Map
results.creator_credit: Binney and Smith, Art Products Division
results.brief_description: Russell Woody shows how to mix colour from a visual, rather than a theoretical perspective. Addresses how to select alternate colours to save money, how to correct failed colour mixes with minimal mixing, how to compare colours for opacity, outstanding coverage and transparency and glazes or washes. Provides an understanding of basic colour terms, how one colour can have several names, how words can distort colour vision and how to alleviate the problem.

results.title: Die Zauberflote = The Magic flute / Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
results.brief_description: Wolfgang Sawallisch conducts the choir and orchestra of the Bayerischen Staatsoper, in this often unsuccesful masterpiece. The director, August Everding, in the 27p. booklet accompanying this video, sees Man, bound together by body and soul, as the principal character of this great drama which describes the road from Nature to Civilisation, and which seeks to reconcile the duality of dark and light, good and evil. The singers include Lucia Popp, Edita Gruberova, Francisco Araiza, Wolfgang Brendel and Kurt Moll. Sung in German.

results.title: The Goalkeeper's fear of the penalty = Die Angst des Tormanns beim Elfmeter
results.creator_credit: Wim Wenders, Peter Genee, Filmverlag der Autoren and Osterreichische Telefilm AG
results.brief_description: A professional goalkeeper, for no apparent reason, allows the opposing team to score an easy goal. A few days later he committs an equally motiveless murder. The film follows the goalkeeper’s retreat to a small village on the Austrian border where he spends his time following television accounts of the police search for the murderer. Wim Wenders’ early film is a claustrophobic study of a man alienated from a sterile society to the point where he can only express his loneliness and fear through acts of random irrationality. An early film of the German New Wave of the seventies, “The Goalkeeper’s Fear of the Penalty” uses the thriller genre to explore contemporary questions of social disintegration.
results.title_for_label: The Goalkeeper’s fear of the penalty = Die Angst des Tormanns beim Elfmeter

results.title: Six in Paris = Paris vu par ...
results.creator_credit: Barbet Schroeder, Claude Chabrol, Eric Rohmer, Jean-Daniel Pollet, Jean-Luc Godard, Jean Douchet, Jean Rouch and Les Films du Losange
results.brief_description: Frustrated in their efforts to find financial backing, six French film-makers took to the streets of Paris with scripts of their own devising and 16mm cameras in this demonstration of low budget, rapid production filmmaking. Many of the directors, actors and cinematographers in this compilation would go on to become central figures of the French New Wave. 1.”Saint-Germain-des-Pres” (Jean Douchet) An American studying in Paris is dropped by one French boy only to be picked up by another 2.”Gare du Nord” (Jean Rouch) A young couple’s row is observed in real time in one continuous take 3.”Rue-Saint Denis” (Jean-Daniel Pollet) A shy dishawasher brings a prostitute back to his room 4.”Place de l’Etoile (Eric Rohmer) A businessman hits a tramp with his umberella and imagines he has killed him 5.”Montparnasse et Levallois” (Jean-Luc Godard) A girl fears she has mixed up letters to her two lovers 6.”La Muette” (Claude Chabrol) A young boy tired of hearing his parents argue buys earplugs and fails to hear his mother’s cry for help. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Teachers of the world. Part 1
results.brief_description: Globalisation of information, new technologies, the changing nature of our lives and our work, are factors forcing educators everywhere to face an unprecedented period of reassessment. The teachers in this video are meeting the challenge head-on. “Australia”: Stephanie Lawrence, a teacher from Devonport, Tasmania, uses self actualisation techniques to develop her students self-esteem. “Japan”: Shigeto Honda, a teacher from Ichikawa City near Tokyo, teaches his students about the diversities of Asian cultures by experiencing first hand. “Canada and Finland”: Pekka Hynninen from Rantasalmi in rural Finland takes his students on a hike and boat trip for a scientific environmental study. The class of Rachel Hunneault from Northern Ontario participates in an interactive Telecommunications Network.

results.title: Forbidden love: the unashamed stories of lesbian lives
results.creator_credit: Aerlyn Weissman, Lynne Fernie, Ginny Stikeman, Margaret Pettigrew and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Against a backdrop of bookcovers from lurid lesbian pulp novels, “Forbidden Love” paints a compelling and often hilarious portrait of lesbian sexuality and survival in Canada in the 1950’s and 60’s when lesbian love was consigned to the twilight world of silence and exile. Ten women tell their own stories of first loves and life in the clandestine subculture with the candour of true survivors. Due to the explicit nature of certain scenes, viewer discretion is advised.
results.title_for_label: Forbidden love: the unashamed stories of lesbian lives

results.title: The Writing on the screen
results.creator_credit: Carol Stowe, Lois Bianchi, Mark Anderson, Granada Television International, Thirteen and WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “The Shape of the world”.
Modern mapping technologies enable us to compile information on everything from earthquakes, AIDS epidemics and mineral exploration to the structure of the human brain. The mapping of our planet’s physical features is now complete, but its future well-being is largely in our hands. Using remote sensing technologies we can map changes in the natural world, and chart the warning signals - but will we use this knowledge to prevent disaster before it is too late?

results.title: Beating about the bush
results.creator_credit: Caroline Sherwood, Nicholas Adler and Titus Films
results.brief_description: The film follows the tour of Djaambi, a half Aboriginal, half white, urban band from Melbourne, under the leadership of Richard Frankland as they travel to remote Aboriginal communities in outback Australia. It explores the cultural mix within the band and the culture shock all members of the band, particularly the Aboriginal members, experience as they meet another, very different side of their culture. Towards the end of the tour the various problems and cultural confusions become focused in a radical split between the white film makers and the more vocal Aboriginal band members. A disturbing look at good intentions gone wrong.

results.title: Deep in my heart
results.creator_credit: Stanley Donen, Roger Edens and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: This film ‘biopic’ portrays the life of composer Sigmund Romberg, whose scores included “The Desert Song” and “Maytime”. While Broadway swings to the jazzy beat of ragtime, Romberg chooses to play the beautiful waltzes of his native country. When Romberg is convinced by the owner of the Cafe Vienna to try his hand at ragtime he writes a hit song in no time at all. Romberg writes one smash hit after another and eventually creates a hit show that takes Broadway by storm. Based on the book by Elliot Arnold. Stars Jose Ferrer, Merle Oberon, Helen Traubel, Walter Pidgeon with special guest appearances by Ann Miller, Rosemary Clooney, Cyd Charisse, Gene Kelly and Howard Keel.
